docs.name: Haiti: Urban population
docs.description:
Urban population refers to people living in urban areas as defined by national statistical offices. It is calculated using World Bank population estimates and urban ratios from the United Nations World Urbanization Prospects.
Urban population

docs.name: Croatia: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate.   Primary
docs.description:
Gender parity index for net enrolment rate. Primary is the ratio of female net enrolment rate for primary to the male net enrolment rate for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females. 
Gender parity index for net enrolment rate.   Primary

docs.name: Denmark: average years of total schooling, 70-74, total
docs.description:
Average years of total schooling, 70-74, total is the average years of education completed among people age 70-74. 
average years of total schooling, 70-74, total

docs.name: Serbia: Outstanding loan to pay school fees, female (% age 15+)
docs.description:
Adults who currently have a loan they took out to pay for school fees (% female, age 15+)
Outstanding loan to pay school fees, female (% age 15+)

docs.name: Slovenia: proportion, 55-59, male, tertiary
docs.description:
Proportion, 55-59, male, tertiary is the proportion of the male population age 55-59 with tertiary education.
proportion, 55-59, male, tertiary

docs.name: Mongolia: Mortality rate, under-5 (per 1,000 live births)
docs.description:
Level & Trends in Child Mortality. Estimates Developed by the UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (UNICEF, WHO, World Bank, UN DESA, UNPD).
Mortality rate, under-5 (per 1,000 live births)

docs.name: Zimbabwe: Proportion of unskilled workers (out of all production workers) (%)
docs.description:
Percentage of unskilled workers, out of all production workers.   Source:World Bank, Enterprise Surveys Project(http://www.enterprisesurveys.org/Data/ExploreTopics/workforce).
Proportion of unskilled workers (out of all production workers) (%)

docs.name: Algeria: ODA aid disbursements for STD control including HIV/AIDS, DAC donors (current US$)
docs.description:
All activities related to sexually transmitted diseases and HIV/AIDS control e.g. information, education and communication; testing; prevention; treatment, care.  Note: data for Sub-Saharan Africa include "South of Sahara regional".  Detailed descriptions are available www.oecd.org/dac/stats/crs/directives.  
ODA aid disbursements for STD control including HIV/AIDS, DAC donors (current US$)

docs.name: Moldova: Saved any money in the past year, secondary education or more (% age 15+)
docs.description:
Adults who saved or set aside any money in the past 12 months (% with a secondary education or more, age 15+)
Saved any money in the past year, secondary education or more (% age 15+)

docs.name: Guinea-Bissau: Regulatory Quality (number of surveys/polls)
docs.description:
See definition GV.REGL.LA.ES.  This is the number of surveys/polls used to derive the GV.REGL.LA.ES.  
Regulatory Quality (number of surveys/polls)

docs.name: Lithuania: Pupil-teacher ratio.  Pre-primary
docs.description:
Pupil-teacher ratio. Pre-primary is the number of pupils enrolled in pre-primary divided by the number of pre-primary school teachers.
Pupil-teacher ratio.  Pre-primary

docs.name: Fiji: Primary completion rate, male (% of relevant age group)
docs.description:
Primary completion rate. Male is the total number of new male entrants in the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, expressed as percentage of the total male population of the theoretical entrance age to the last grade of primary. This indicator is also known as "gross intake rate to the last grade of primary." The ratio can exceed 100% due to over-aged and under-aged children who enter primary school late/early and/or repeat grades. 
Primary completion rate, male (% of relevant age group)

docs.name: Peru: Loan from an informal private lender in the past year, rural (% age 15+)
docs.description:
Adults who borrowed any money in the past 12 months from a private lender (including informal money lenders) (% living in an urban area, age 15+ )
Loan from an informal private lender in the past year, rural (% age 15+)

docs.name: Guinea-Bissau: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 1. Female
docs.description:
Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 1. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100. 
Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 1. Female

docs.name: Ghana: Agricultural tractors, imports
docs.description:
Agricultural machinery refers to the number of wheel and crawler tractors (excluding garden tractors) in use in agriculture at the end of the calendar year specified or during the first quarter of the following year.
Agricultural tractors, imports

docs.name: Serbia: Outstanding loan for health or emergencies, female (% age 15+)
docs.description:
Adults who currently have a loan they took out for emergency or health purposes (% female, age 15+)
Outstanding loan for health or emergencies, female (% age 15+)

docs.name: Malta: population in thousand, 20 - 24, female, primary
docs.description:
Population in thousand, 20-24, female, primary is the total number of females age 20-24 (in thousands) with primary education.
population in thousand, 20 - 24, female, primary

docs.name: Oman: Population, aged 4- 6, male
docs.description:
Population, age 4-6, male is the total number of males age 4-6.
Population, aged 4- 6, male

docs.name: Guatemala: Gender parity index for new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience
docs.description:
Gender parity index for new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience is the ratio of the female percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females. 
Gender parity index for new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience

docs.name: Dominican Republic: (%) Program beneficiaries in 3rd 20% population - Old Age Contributory
docs.description:
It presents the (%) Program beneficiaries in 3rd 20% population for Old Age Contributory
(%) Program beneficiaries in 3rd 20% population - Old Age Contributory

The World Bank's mission is to fight poverty with passion and professionalism for lasting results.

Free and open access to data about development in countries around the globe.
